availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, sheriff. Kentucky native. Son of John Merideth and Celia Merideth. Married to Sarah Ann Rhodes Merideth in Edmonson County, Kentucky, in July 1855. Father of Beverly M. Merideth, Jeff D. Merideth, and Amos Merideth. Laborer in Edmonson County in 1850. Sheriff in Edmonson County in 1860 and 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 43B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 14.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Lucus, p. 232B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky,
Edmonson County Marriages, Film 000367221, p. 129.
"William Scott Merideth (1831-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial 71448427, accessed March 3, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/71448427.
